ticket.title: Markov-blanket channel enforcement and no-bypass launch actuation

tickets.reason: Launch contract and admission checks must exist before channel enforcement hardening.
Typed adapter/tool-intent path is required for boundary enforcement.

in_scope: Restrict authoritative actuation to typed tool-intent channel events.
Treat free-form model output as non-authoritative evidence only.
Enforce no-bypass path through broker + capability + context-firewall checks.
Emit structured defects for channel-boundary and bypass violations.

steps: Implement authoritative input gate restricted to typed channel envelopes.
Add bypass guards around broker/capability/context-firewall path.
Emit defect taxonomy for boundary violations.
Add adversarial replay tests for untyped/bypass attempts.

criteria: Untyped/free-form outputs cannot drive authoritative actuation.
No bypass route exists around broker/capability/context-firewall enforcement.
Boundary violations deny and emit structured defects.

notes.security: Boundary typing and no-bypass guarantees are mandatory containment invariants.
notes.verification: Validate adversarial cases including replay and malformed channel envelopes.
notes.general: This ticket implements the launch-path boundary contract required by HSI safety semantics.
